title.native: 機動戦艦ナデシコ The prince of darkness
title.romaji: Kidou Senkan Nadesico: The prince of darkness
title.english: Martian Successor Nadesico: The Prince of Darkness

description: Two years have passed since the end of the "Martian Successor Nadesico". Akito and Yurika have disappeared. The Jovians and the Earthlings have joined forces and Ruri is now captain of Nadesico B. As the popularity of Boson Jumping grows, a vast transportation network has been developed. Dubbed the Hisago Plan, this network of Chulip portals holds the answers to the mysteries behind Bose particles and their power. If those secrets should fall into the wrong hands, it could mean big trouble. And big trouble there is. A Martian splinter group has launched an offensive, leaving the United Forces befuddled and desperate. So much so, in fact, that the former crew of the Nadesico is called back to active duty for a special unsanctioned mission-to save us all. Does this menagerie of misfits have what it takes? Who will win the race for the Boson technology? And what the heck happened to Akito and Yurika?

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

エリナ・キンジョウ・ウォン
ミスマル・コウイチロウ

node.description:
__[Website](http://goto.cute.or.jp)__

Gotou began his career as an animator at Atorie. After the closing of Atorie, he worked for other studios such as Project Team Muu and Fenx before going freelancer. He serves as character designer, animation director and animator on countless anime series and contributes to a monthly comic strip to Newtype magazine.

He has been an animator since he graduated from high school at 18. Unlike most other animators Gotou had never gone to an art school. He became interested in animation after seeing an advertisement in an animation magazine saying that animators were needed. Without having any connections within the industry he went on and joined Atelier Giga and studied there for a year under [Akihiko Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/103299/) before marking his debut as animator on [Mister Ajikko](https://anilist.co/anime/3437/).

In 1988 Studio Atelier declared bancrupcy and he went to Project Team Muu, which later became Phoenix Entertainment. His first work there was as animator on Anime Sanjushi. When working on the Yuusha Saga, he met Ishida Atsuko on Densetsu no Yuusha Da Garn, who influenced Gotou in his character design, particularly the design of the eyes. Together with the experience from training under Yamashita Akihiko this influence resulted in Gotou's so called "gocky picture" later.

He made his debut as character designer on Choujin Densetsu Urotsukidouji 4 and his debut as series director on Kiddy Grade.

Married to [Megumi Kadonosono](https://anilist.co/staff/100963/).

(Source: Anidb)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/116444028) | [Website](http://www.dragon-brave.com)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/116444028) | [Website](http://www.dragon-brave.com)
Birthplace: Tokyo, Japan Website (artist page) Oomori Toshiyuki is a Japanese composer, arranger, pianist and musician.
Birthplace: Tokyo, Japan Website (artist page) Oomori Toshiyuki is a Japanese composer, arranger, pianist and musician.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/石井明治)

Freelancer with deep ties to [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).

Grandson of composer Ryoichi Hattori and son of composer Katsuhisa Hattori, Takayuki Hattori started out his career as a music arranger for Masashi Sada before given his big break by being allowed to compose Godzilla vs. SpaceGodzilla (1994), after Akira Ifukube turned down the oppurtinty. Hattori's body of work tends to be diverse, ranging from comedies like Welcome Back, Mr. McDonald (1997) to Toei's movie adaption of the GTO TV drama series.
Also is a writer, producer and director for ADV Films and Robotboy Films.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2256470167)

After graduating from high school, Kubota went through training at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/)'s research center before dropping out and joining [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/) in 1998. Three years later in he met [Sushio](https://anilist.co/staff/103619/) at Comiket, which led to Kubota joining [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). There he made his debut as an animation director on the premiere of [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/277/)'s second season.

In 2005, he made his debut as a character designer, although still jointly together with Sushio and [Takaaki Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/110187/), on the 6th [One Piece](https://anilist.co/anime/464/) movie. The film was directed by Mamoru Hosoda, which led to Kubota getting an invite to join the production of [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/) as an animation director. After this he kept working at Gainax until going freelance.

In 2012, he worked as the main character designer on [From the New World](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/) and [Robotics;Notes](https://anilist.co/anime/13599/), and a few years later he served as one on [One-Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/), which earned him international fame.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NobuyoshiHabara)

Married to [Kumiko Habara](https://anilist.co/staff/148694/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1522114648098619397)

He grew up admiring anime such as [Space Battleship Yamato](https://anilist.co/anime/1650/) an during highschool he started animating with his friends. He enrolled into a professional animation school after graduating but quit quickly due to being disappointed in how the lessons were conducted.

He joined Anime R and later its subsidiary Studio Muu. His first work was as an in-betweener on [Psycho Armor Govarian](https://anilist.co/anime/6428/) while his debut as a key animator was on [Captain Tsubasa](https://anilist.co/anime/2116/).

After working on [Mamoru Oshii](https://anilist.co/staff/99097/)'s [Patlabor](https://anilist.co/anime/1095/) he permanently joined Production I.G. becoming known, together with [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/) and [Tetsuya Nishio](https://anilist.co/staff/103725/), as "The Three Gods of I.G."

He's is one of the most prominent animators of the realist school, with emphasis on solid shapes and weighty character animation.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/関口可奈味)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/), currently affilaited with [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ynaritaka)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/141121934) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akemi_h_0808/) | [Blog](http://replica08.web.fc2.com/index.html)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/animesama) | [Blog](http://animesama.cocolog-nifty.com/)

Chief writer of Animestyle magazine.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kia_asamiya) | [Blog](https://minkara.carview.co.jp/userid/518151/blog/)

Real name is Kikuchi Michitaka, which he uses when doing character design or animation work. Best known for the 12 volume manga Silent Mobius, which has been adapted as two anime films, and later a separate series. Also made a parallel manga version of Martian Successor Nadesico called Meteor Schlachtschiff Nadesico. Already a fan of western pop culture, moved to America and got employed by Marvel on the X-Men comic, but also continues his own work.

He is a member of the manga studios [Lab Garnier](https://twitter.com/Lab_garnier) and [Studio Tron](http://www.tron.co.jp/top.html).
Yukinao Shimoji was a Japanese producer and production manager. Formerly the president and representative director of [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/Xebec).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/角川歴彦)

The chief executive officer of Kadokawa. Son of Genyoshi Kadokawa, the founder of the company.

Kadokawa was arrested on September 14, 2022 on suspicion of bribing a former member of the Tokyo 2020 Summer Olympics organizing committee, which he denies. He resigned from the company after he was indicted on the charges in October.
__Mika Akitaka__ is a Japanese illustrator, game creator and character, mechanical and prop designer
Hideyuki Tanaka is a sound director for anime and the founder and representative director of sound production studio Audio Tanaka.

__[Website](http://goto.cute.or.jp)__

Gotou began his career as an animator at Atorie. After the closing of Atorie, he worked for other studios such as Project Team Muu and Fenx before going freelancer. He serves as character designer, animation director and animator on countless anime series and contributes to a monthly comic strip to Newtype magazine.

He became interested in animation after seeing an advertisement in an animation magazine saying that animators were needed. When working on the Yuusha Saga, he met Ishida Atsuko on Densetsu no Yuusha Da Garn, who influenced Gotou in his character design, particularly the design of the eyes. Together with the experience from training under Yamashita Akihiko this influence resulted in Gotou's so called "gocky picture" later.

He made his debut as character designer on Choujin Densetsu Urotsukidouji 4 and his debut as series director on Kiddy Grade.

Married to [Megumi Kadonosono](https://anilist.co/staff/100963/).

(Source: Anidb)
